Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can identify and draw a simple fish shape and indicate it is in water.
The student can label the fish and might include some basic resources like water.
The student can show some parts of the habitat vaguely, like water and potentially a plant.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly label food for the fish (may label an inappropriate item like rocks as food).
The student may struggle to accurately illustrate and label how specific plants provide protection (might miss labeling or incorrectly label).
The student is unlikely to depict or label other living things correctly (may draw unrelated animals or miss this entirely).
The student may not illustrate or explain relationships between the fish and its habitat, such as how the habitat supports survival (might draw disconnected elements with no clear explanation).
The student may not describe or show the interconnectedness of the fish and its habitat as a system (might show unrelated components without interaction).
